sourcesContent: import React from 'react'; import { Box, Typography, useMediaQuery, useTheme } from '@mui/material'; import Image from '../../assets/images/openflowmachine.png'; import Image2 from '../../assets/images/closeupwatermachine.png'; import Image3 from '../../assets/images/Toolsforuse.png'; const OpenFlowMachinePortfolio = () => { const theme = useTheme(); const isMobile = useMediaQuery(theme.breakpoints.down('sm')); const imageStyle = isMobile ? { width: '100%', height: 'auto', marginTop: '20px' } : { maxWidth: '80%', height: 'auto', marginTop: '20px', display: 'block', marginLeft: 'auto', marginRight: 'auto' }; return ( Open Flow Water Channel Machine in Virtual Reality At Mohawk College, I worked on converting a space-consuming Open Flow Water Machine into a virtual reality experience. This project aimed to enhance accessibility and save space. Project Scene Layout The VR setup allowed students to conduct experiments using VR headsets, making labs more accessible and repurposing physical space. Close-up of the Machine A significant challenge was developing realistic water simulation in VR. I explored various methods, including Eulerian and Lagrangian, to accurately simulate fluid dynamics. Lab Tools in VR The project involved overcoming computational challenges and integrating the simulation with Unity. It was a successful endeavor that enhanced student learning and showcased the potential of VR in education. This experience at Mohawk College was not only about technical development but also about learning and applying fluid dynamics, underscoring the importance of practical application in education. ); }; export default OpenFlowMachinePortfolio;
